data.title: Can generate html directly from markdown preview?
data.body:
I'm using markdown and the preview is very nice, I can see instant preview while typing, but when I use other tool to generate html, it always not as I expect, or I have to adjust markdown source again and again. (Preview is not useful for me anymore)

So does VSCode support to generate html from preview directly? Or this is a new feature request.

data.title: Viewing temporarily unzipped files using 7-Zip
data.body:
I would like to use VSCode also in the following use case:
- configure 7-Zip to use VSCode as editor
- open zip file in 7-Zip, select compressed file, hit F4
- file should open in VSCode

Currently the behavior varies:
- the file is opened in VSCode but it is immediately closed (in most cases)
- VSCode displays an error saying that file was not found (sometimes)
- file stays open in VSCode as expected (exceptionally) 

This feature could probably be implemented by #11642 but maybe it is not enough.

Currently I use Notepad++ for opening those files in which case
1. 7-Zip somehow knows that the file is being viewed and it doesn't delete it
2. Notepad++ asks user whether it should keep deleted file opened when 7-Zip already deleted the file

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

data.title: Add ability to change snippets icon
Snippets don't show up after trigger characters
data.body:
希望用户的snippet永远放在首选位置
Hope that the user's snippet will always be in the preferred position

data.title: Feature Request: Setting shortcut
data.body:
I would like a keyboard shortcut to be present for the editor.

Often I like to enter the settings panel. The addition of a keyboard shortcut would create 1 less click for the end user.

data.title: Option for tasks.json 2.0.0 to always run task in new terminal

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
Hi!

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

I would be great to have a possibility to set a task property to e.g. `openNewWindow: true` and it will always run such task in a new terminal window.

Thanks.

data.title: Debugger doesn't stop at a breakpoint which is set in my extension's code
data.body:
Hello everyone.

Visual Studio Code's version: 1.10.1
OS: Windows 10, Ubuntu 16.04, Fedora 25

At first, I tried it with my extension, it didn't work.

I created a new one via `yo code`, chose **TypeScript**.
I set a breakpoint at the beginning of `activate()`.
I ran it.
It didn't stop.

I modified **launch.json** in order to set `"stopOnEntry"` to `true`.
I ran it again.
It stopped.

data.title: Detection of tasks  does not work with tasks 2.0.0
data.body:
Hi!

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

Steps to Reproduce:

1. started Code and let it detect all tasks (tasks.json generated with 0.1.0)
2. "cmd+p task" ...and all my tasks provided by grunt file are there, so far so good
3. added one custom modified task to tasks.json
4. tried to run that task...still works
5. changed version of tasks from 0.1.0 to 2.0.0
6. "cmd+p task" ...and only my explicitly defined task is there, any other task from grunt file :/
7. explicit task can be run without any problem...but any other task

Thanks!

data.title: JSLint error with ES2017 Decorator
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1 (1.10.1)
- OS Version: MacOS sierra 10.12.3 (16D32)

When use decorator with koa:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2549087/23694292/fe4d893e-0413-11e7-9707-e115ab918935.png)

I got: 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2549087/23694306/11c399ea-0414-11e7-9995-2f78cb9f4db6.png)

My setting:
.babelrc:
```
{
  "presets": ["es2015", "es2017"],
  "plugins": [
    "transform-decorators-legacy",
    "transform-runtime",
    "add-module-exports"
  ]
}
```
jsconfig.json:
```
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "ES6",
    "module": "commonjs",
    "experimentalDecorators": true
  },
  "exclude": [
    "node_modules"
  ]
}
```

data.title: Partition our main.ts into different performance categories

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Today we try to move code that should run after the first window opens after the `windows.open()` method in main.ts. I suggest to make this more explicit by partioning main.ts into different performance categories:
- critical path (until window opens)
- needed for the window (e.g. shared process)
- non critical (e.g. `menu`, `jumplist`)

This could maybe be triggered from `lifecycle.ts` and help us move code to the correct place for best critical startup performance.

- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.1 (653f8733dd5a5c43d66d7168b4701f94d72b62e5, 2017-03-02T00:33:15.706Z)

data.title: Option to disable sidebar sync
data.body:
Description: Add option to disable automatically navigating to a file in tree view/sidebar when searching with go to file

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: macOS (all)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have sidebar/tree view open with multiple files searchable
2. Initiate go to file (command+p) and navigate to file
3. Observe in the sidebar/tree that it automatically navigates to the file in the tree view

data.title: Language specific colorTheme user setting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Win10

This is pretty much a quality-of-life request & would remove the manual action of constantly changing colour theme when working on a specific set of languages (mainly AGC) in [chrislgarry/Apollo-11](https://github.com/chrislgarry/Apollo-11) or [virtualagc/virtualagc](https://github.com/virtualagc/virtualagc), then switching back to my dark theme when working on anything else.

Reasoning is simply due to the archived printouts being printed with black text on white, where its far easier to compare the transcribed code in VS Code with the images and spot typos when they're a similar colour - instead of contrasting.

Although it might not be possible, as no other setting under `workbench` is configurable by language.

Example:
![](http://www.ibiblio.org/apollo/ScansForConversion/Comanche055/1316.jpg)

data.title: VS Code background operations should not steal user's text input focus

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 (Anniversary Update)

I opened VS Code today and tried to switch files, and as I did so I VS Code pulled focus to the console because it was automatically updating packages. This is a poor UX.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open VS Code (with outdated packages)
2. Ctrl+P
3. Switch to file
4. Try to type code

Expected result:
Update packages in the background, or don't pull text focus if the console needs to open automatically.

data.title: debug console code completion stays after closing function parenthesis, with __defineGetter__ highlighted
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Mac 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

code completion menu tends to stick around after closing parenthesis, but highlights the top of the menu `__defineGetter__`.  What happens is you write `.somefunc` which in the case which has the context menu showing, and then you complete `.somefunc()`, but then the completion menu still shows with `__defineGetter__` at the top

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1776100/23680968/ef5270ac-0341-11e7-8f46-97dbb58fce91.png)

You finish writing your function and then press enter, but get the trailing `__defineGetter__` on the end which is really annoying.

This is using type `node` for debugging.

data.title: Git amend - message and staging

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hi!

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

1) When I need to amend last git commit, most of the time I don't want to change the last commit's message. So VSCode should use the last commit's message as a default when no new message is explicitly provided. Currently, a warning dialog appears and the user is forced to look at last message and paste it there again manually.

2) ~~Also, explicit Staging of files to amend is a bit clumsy. Most of the time I want to amend all the files I edited. Imho it would be much better if it would behave the same as for common Commit action. So that "everything is part of amending, until something is explicitly staged...then only staged files are part of amending".~~

Thanks a lot!
